key_events.description: Physical vacancy decreased from 4.3% to 2.3% in January 2026 after new contracts in Cajamar/SP and Rio de Janeiro/RJ. Financial vacancy is at 1.4%.

Distribution of R$ 0.82 per share announced in January 2026, with a base date of December 30, 2025, and payment on January 15, 2026, yielding 9.3% annualized based on December's closing price of R$ 105.82.
The 8th issuance of shares raised R$ 937,633,237.13. New shares began trading on January 6, 2026, enabling acquisitions from FIIs RBRL11 and RDLI11.
Grupo VIP ended its temporary lease of module 1 in Especulativo Cajamar (15,049 m²) in March 2025. Volo replaced a temporary lease with a definitive contract for 1,461.89 m² in SBP.

risk_factors: Tenant concentration (Leroy Merlin, Renner, Mercado Livre)

investment_thesis.bull_case: Decreasing vacancy rates and consistent dividend payouts make XPLG11 an attractive investment. The 8th share issuance allows for strategic acquisitions, potentially increasing future revenue.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Tenant departures and fluctuations in vacancy rates could negatively impact revenue. The fund is exposed to risks associated with tenant concentration.

summary_markdown: XPLG11 shows positive signs with a decrease in physical vacancy to 2.3% as of January 2026, and a financial vacancy of 1.4%. The fund announced a dividend distribution of R$ 0.82 per share in January 2026, reflecting a 9.3% annualized yield based on the December closing price of R$ 105.82. The 8th share issuance, raising R$ 937,633,237.13, closed in January 2026 and facilitated acquisitions from FIIs RBRL11 and RDLI11. In March 2025, Grupo VIP ended a lease in Cajamar (15,049 m²), while Volo secured a definitive contract for 1,461.89 m² in SBP. Key tenants include Leroy Merlin (12-13%), Renner (8-9%), and Mercado Livre (9%).
